cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Port Aransas, TX and 105 miles S of Port O’Connor, TX
cyclone.trajectory: moving north along the south-central Texas coast today, then turning NNE tonight and Tuesday toward the upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Matagorda Bay / San Luis Pass area

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning; Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: No hurricane or tropical-storm watch posted for Sabine Pass–Port Arthur segment (Hurricane Watch only Port Aransas–San Luis Pass).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from the Mouth of the Rio Grande northward to Sabine Pass; Storm Surge Warning Port Aransas to Sabine Pass including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: upper Texas coast from Matagorda Bay through Galveston Bay to Sabine Pass and into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible beginning early Tuesday, highest chance 24 % cumulative with 12 % peak onset probability.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of inundation possible in Sabine Lake and along the Port Arthur water front under Storm Surge Warning.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches expected with locally higher totals; considerable flash and urban flooding possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible along the upper Texas coast; dangerous rip currents and elevated waves in Sabine Pass channel.
